page.title: 05Shopping Survey page 2.
page.content: Cont.from (p.1.)Q1. This was followed by 40% who travelled 5 to 10 miles away travelling from the bottom end of the Merthyr valley and across from the Cynon and Rhymney valleys.The few left were passing trade. Q2.How often did they shop there? Most (71%) shopped there once a week, 19% once a fortnight,and the 10% left less than once a month. Q3.Reasons chosen for shopping there. 69% chose late opening,17% chose all round shopping while the rest chose free bus service or cheaper prices. From our results it would seem that a typical Asda shopper shops there for its convenient opening hours and wide range of goods.He or she shops there every week often on the same day.It would seem that out of town shopping is here to stay.
